perturbation.original_text: 2. Payment to WYZZ-TV. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, WYZZ shall continue to be the owner of and shall be entitled to all revenues resulting from the sale of advertising and other time on WYZZ-TV before, during and/or after the Term; provided, however, in consideration of the Services, Nexstar shall be entitled to all revenues resulting from the sale of advertising and other time on the Stations during the Term remaining after the payment of the amounts set forth below: (a) Within seventy-five (75) days following the end of each month of a calendar year during the Term that "BCF" (as defined below) for such month, when combined with BCF for all prior months during such calendar year (other than any month which is outside the Term) is less than the Minimum BCF, Nexstar shall pay a fee to WYZZ in an amount equal to thirty-five percent (35%) of BCF for such month.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Payment to WYZZ-TV. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, WYZZ shall continue to be the owner of and shall be entitled to all revenues resulting from the sale of advertising and other time on WYZZ-TV before, during and/or after the Term; provided, however, in consideration of the Services, Nexstar shall be entitled to a portion of the revenues resulting from the sale of advertising and other time on the Stations during the Term as set forth below: (a) Within seventy-five (75) days following the end of each month of a calendar year during the Term that "BCF" (as defined below) for such month, when combined with BCF for all prior months during such calendar year (other than any month which is outside the Term) is less than the Minimum BCF, Nexstar shall retain all of the BCF for such month.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Nexstar is entitled to revenues remaining AFTER payments to WYZZ, while the modified text implies Nexstar can retain all of the BCF under certain conditions, directly contradicting the initial entitlement of WYZZ to all revenues.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Material Considerations. Except to the extent inconsistent with law or the rules and regulations of any governmental agency, during the Term, each of the following considerations and undertakings (the "Material Considerations") by Nexstar shall require the prior consent of, and prior consultation with, WYZZ: a. the setting of annual budgets (the "Annual Budgets") for the operation of the Stations (as more specifically addressed in Section 11 hereof); b. determining the necessity for, and amount of, any single capital expenditure for either of the Stations to the extent not provided for in the applicable Annual Budget; provided, WYZZ's consent shall not be required for Nexstar to make unbudgeted capital expenditures in any calendar year which is necessary to maintain or restore the normal operations and transmission of the Station and which in the aggregate are not in excess of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000)
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Material Considerations. During the Term, none of the following considerations and undertakings (the "Material Considerations") by Nexstar shall require the prior consent of, or prior consultation with, WYZZ: a. the setting of annual budgets (the "Annual Budgets") for the operation of the Stations (as more specifically addressed in Section 11 hereof); b. determining the necessity for, and amount of, any single capital expenditure for either of the Stations to the extent not provided for in the applicable Annual Budget; provided, WYZZ's consent shall be required for Nexstar to make any unbudgeted capital expenditures in any calendar year which is necessary to maintain or restore the normal operations and transmission of the Station and which in the aggregate are in excess of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000)
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Nexstar to get WYZZ approval for material undertakings while the modified version is rewritten to imply Nexstar does NOT need WYZZ approval for any material undertaking unless the cost is in excess of $50,000, which is an in-text contradiction to the first half of the text.

perturbation.original_text: 10. Additional Covenants a. Prior Contract Commitments. Schedule 10.a. contains a list and amount of all non-programming contractual commitments made by WYZZ prior to the Effective Time (other than cash commitments for commercial advertising time), but which are continuing obligations of WYZZ during the Term. In providing the Services, Nexstar shall honor all such commitments, as well as commitments for commercial advertising time to be aired on WYZZ-TV during the Term (for cash or trade) (collectively "WYZZ Contracts"); provided, Nexstar shall not honor any trade liabilities of either Station to the extent the aggregate trade liabilities of such Station as of the Effective Time exceeds by more than Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($25,000) the trade receivables of such Station as of the Effective Time.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. Additional Covenants a. Prior Contract Commitments. Schedule 10.a. contains a list and amount of all non-programming contractual commitments made by WYZZ prior to the Effective Time (other than cash commitments for commercial advertising time), but which are continuing obligations of WYZZ during the Term. In providing the Services, Nexstar is NOT required to honor all such commitments. Nexstar shall be liable for all trade liabilities of either Station even if the aggregate trade liabilities of such Station as of the Effective Time exceeds by more than Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($25,000) the trade receivables of such Station as of the Effective Time.
perturbation.explanation: The first half of the text states Nexstar SHALL honor commitments but the rewritten portion states that Nexstar is NOT required to honor commitments. The last sentence is contradictory as it makes Nexstar liable for liabilities greater than 25,000 when that was originally NOT allowed.
